tspan.tspan: A TopicPlayer receives a list of slides and calls the draw
method of each one to handle transitions between each.
TopicPlayers have a height and width at creation and are
typically drawn with offsets in x and y. This creates a rectangle
they are responsible for drawing within the infobeamer node.
Each TopicPlayer is given style information that controls
how Topics are drawn. This includes hints for padding, so
critical information can be drawn in regions that other
design elements may overlap. Padding is specified in a list -
[top, right, bottom, left] - similar to CSS.
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Donec lobortis
elit quis nisi tincidunt tincidunt sit amet nec nisl. Etiam vitae turpis vel
arcu facilisis suscipit. Vestibulum interdum turpis vitae ex iaculis
bibendum. Nulla ultrices nibh nec felis sodales, sit amet tincidunt enim
fermentum. Cras vel gravida ipsum, at fermentum augue. Aliquam vitae
blandit dui. Nam non porta felis.
Topics need to gracefully handle paging or truncating their
content based on the dimensions and margins. They can
include lower priority content like backgrounds over the entire
region.
There is no concept of a border or margin like in CSS.
The topic types are:
* TopicInfo - displays text in the content on topic of an image that extends into the padding
* TopicSessionList - for short sessions. Has a "compact" form for narrow TopicPlayers.
* TopicSessionBrief - designed for sessions that are open long-term
